dataset.title: Effects of forest tending management strategies on carbon storage (1/3)

abstract.para: The purpose of this study is to explore the biomass and carbon storage of Taiwan cypress (Chameacyparis formosensis) and Taiwania trees (Taiwania cryptomerioides) grown with different silvicultural treatments in built permanent plots. The growth characteristics and mortality of trees from plots are investigated. Fifty sample trees are felled for stem analysis and surveying biomass for each species. The DBH, tree height, volume and biomass of stem, branch, and leaf of sampled trees are measured and investigated. Moreover, an increment borer was used to cut cores from trees. The bulk density and ring characteristics of sampled cores are investigated by time sequence method and soft x-ray densitometer techniques. The biomass and carbon storage are calculated from the tree growth and ring density characteristics. The applicable forest management could be analyzed and decided by evaluating the biomass and carbon storage of Taiwan cypress and Taiwania trees grown in different silvicultural regimes. The appropriate strategies of management that include thinning stand age, stand density, thinning time, interval of thinning treatments, utilization of thinned wood, and rotation, etc. are very important and assessed.

section.title: Sites
section.para: 1. The experimental Taiwania plantations used in this study were located on a site in compartments no.3 and no.12, Liukuei Experimental forest, TFRI, Kaohsiung, and in compartment no.73, La-Ro-Shi, Pingtung District Office, Pingtung, Taiwan.

section.title: Methods
section.para: The diameter at breast height, tree height, basal area, volume, mortality of a tree were investigated.
(1) Cryptomeria japonica and cypress trees, respectively were selected for sample trees by DBH distribution 50 plantation
(2) The biomass of stem, branch, and leaf of sampled trees were measured in sampled trees.
(1) The increment cores were collected from each sampled tree at breast height.
(2) The oven-dry density, moisture content, and carbon expansion factor were measured in each sampled cores.
(3) The nine ring characteristics were measured and calculated by soft-x-ray scanner (QMS system).
The carbon concentration was measured by Elementar Analyses-system.
